page.title: 15OUR LOCAL NATURE RESERVE
page.content:
{CARVERS ROCKS NATURE RESERVE { }About ten years ago the{Severn Trent {Water Board}bought some land to be made into a reservoir. The water that is put into the reservoir is pumped up from the{River Dove}which is further down the valley. It is only used in the middle of summer when there is not much water about. The water goes to homes in{Leicestershire.}People are not supposed to swim in the reservoir.
When they had built it, the Water Board gave an area of land and water to the{Derbyshire Naturalists' Trust, who made it into a nature reserve. Here animals can live peacefuly and humans can go for walks and enjoy the beautiful place they live near. Boats are not allowed in that area of water because they might disturb the wildlife.
